1.title: Antibiotics - Part 1

episode of.title: Dr. Mona Vand: The Modern Pharmacist (TV Series 2014– )

1.plot: Antibiotics are the most common class of medication, which is used to treat bacterial infections. When taken properly they are very effective, however if used improperly they can do more harm than good.

2.title: Controlled Substances - Part 1

episode of.title: Dr. Mona Vand: The Modern Pharmacist (TV Series 2014– )

2.plot: Have you ever wondered why you can refill some of your prescriptions, but not others? This is based on what category it is classified as.

3.title: Fighting Cellulite - Preparation-H Works!

episode of.title: Dr. Mona Vand: The Modern Pharmacist (TV Series 2014– )

3.plot: If you suffer from cellulite, you're not alone. Almost 90% of women experience cellulite on some parts of their bodies (mainly upper legs and buttocks). Many people wonder: what is cellulite, and what causes it?

4.title: Children's vs. Adult Medication

episode of.title: Dr. Mona Vand: The Modern Pharmacist (TV Series 2014– )

4.plot: When it comes to medication, children and adult medications are drastically different and may be more harmful to your child than you would think.

5.title: Antibiotics- Part 2

episode of.title: Dr. Mona Vand: The Modern Pharmacist (TV Series 2014– )

5.plot: Almost everyone has taken an antibiotic at some point, but a high percentage of patients do not take them correctly.

6.title: Is There a Difference Between Physical Dependence and Addiction?

episode of.title: Dr. Mona Vand: The Modern Pharmacist (TV Series 2014– )

6.plot: While drug dependence and addiction often go hand in hand, many people are surprised to hear that they are actually very different.

7.title: with Russell Simmons

episode of.title: Dr. Mona Vand: The Modern Pharmacist (TV Series 2014– )

7.plot: The Modern Pharmacist recently held a live launch event at The Four Season in Beverly Hills. Working to bridge the gap between pharmaceutical science and overall wellness, the launch event was intended to introduce the brand as well as give press an insight into the objectives of this multi-faceted series. Hosted by Russell Simmons, co-founder of Def Jam Records, attendees and supporters were able to sit down with Dr. Mona Vand to discuss her goals for the brand and how the benefits of The Modern Pharmacist can be used for all demographics.

8.title: Live Interview with Dr. Mona Vand and Lilly Ghalichi

episode of.title: Dr. Mona Vand: The Modern Pharmacist (TV Series 2014– )

8.plot: Dr. Mona Vand recently had the pleasure of doing a live interview with Lilly Ghalichi for her series called: Ghalichi Glam. Lilly is a TV Personality and entrepreneur, and owns numerous beauty and fashion companies. Viewers had the opportunity to call in and ask questions live. The phone lines for the live segment were off the hook. Dr. Mona Vand and Lilly Ghalichi discuss a wide array of topics including: Skincare and Acne How to reduce pore size Which over the counter products are best to use Salicylic Acid vs. Benzoyl Peroxide Birth Control How birth control ...

9.title: Pet Medications

episode of.title: Dr. Mona Vand: The Modern Pharmacist (TV Series 2014– )

9.plot: When it comes to your pets medical care, attention to detail is a must. For this reason, compounding pharmacies are very beneficial and play a huge role when it comes to treating animals.

10.title: Seasonal Allergies Part 1

episode of.title: Dr. Mona Vand: The Modern Pharmacist (TV Series 2014– )

10.plot: Seasonal allergies are affecting 35 million people a year. What most patients do not know, is that you can develop allergies at any point in time even if you've never experienced them in the past.

11.title: Coconut Oil for Dry Cracked Feet

episode of.title: Dr. Mona Vand: The Modern Pharmacist (TV Series 2014– )

11.plot: Going to the spa can be timely and expensive. If you are a price conscious individual, some of the best skin and beauty treatments can often be found in your home.

12.title: Controlled Substances Part 2

episode of.title: Dr. Mona Vand: The Modern Pharmacist (TV Series 2014– )

12.plot: Despite the many reasons patients see their doctors, clinical treatment of pain is still the most common ailment treated within the United States.

13.title: Seasonal Allergies Part 2

episode of.title: Dr. Mona Vand: The Modern Pharmacist (TV Series 2014– )

13.plot: If you are one of the estimated 50 million Americans who battle seasonal allergies every year, you know that they're quite irritating - literally.

14.title: BREAKING: Joe Jackson Suffers Stroke; Three Heart Attacks

episode of.title: Dr. Mona Vand: The Modern Pharmacist (TV Series 2014– )

14.plot: By now, many of you may have heard that Joe Jackson, father of legendary singer Michael Jackson, suffered one stroke and three heart attacks late last month.

15.title: Feeling Good with Exercise Part 1

episode of.title: Dr. Mona Vand: The Modern Pharmacist (TV Series 2014– )

15.plot: Exercise is an important part of living a balanced, healthy life. It keeps you fit, makes you stronger, and can actually prevents disease.

16.title: Baking Soda for Smoother Healthier Skin

episode of.title: Dr. Mona Vand: The Modern Pharmacist (TV Series 2014– )

16.plot: Everyone loves having beautiful skin, but not everyone loves the cost of overpriced skincare products that are often required to get that beautiful skin.

17.title: Heliocare: Sunscreen in a Pill

episode of.title: Dr. Mona Vand: The Modern Pharmacist (TV Series 2014– )

17.plot: Heliocare is a dietary supplement that helps your skin protect itself against the effects of over exposure to the sun. Think of it as internal sunscreen.

1.title: Who is Dr. Mona Vand? Part 1

episode of.title: Dr. Mona Vand: The Modern Pharmacist (TV Series 2014– )

1.plot: We live in an information age - where now more than ever - people are taking control of their health. And from a health-care perspective, it's amazing that so many patients are becoming their own advocate. But even with all of the information currently on the Internet, people still have questions. People need help connecting pharmaceutical science to overall wellness. What you put in your body - whether it's food, alcohol or even antibiotics - can often times have serious consequences. That's what the Modern Pharmacist is all about. Your health is no longer about ...

2.title: Who is Dr. Mona Vand? Part 2

episode of.title: Dr. Mona Vand: The Modern Pharmacist (TV Series 2014– )

2.plot: In an era where prescription drugs continue to play an increasing role in the treatment of millions, Dr. Mona Vand strives to educate and empower patients.

3.title: Hangover Remedies - Do's and Dont's

episode of.title: Dr. Mona Vand: The Modern Pharmacist (TV Series 2014– )

3.plot: Waking up with a hangover can hurt, on so many levels. Whether it is a headache, vomiting, upset stomach, or overall pain, most people are willing to take anything to help.

4.title: Hangover Remedies Prickly Pear Extract + Ginger

episode of.title: Dr. Mona Vand: The Modern Pharmacist (TV Series 2014– )

4.plot: Prickly Pear Cactus is a plant that has been used in many parts of the world. The supplement - Prickly Pear Extract - has multiple uses, and this includes preventing hangovers.

5.title: Hangover Remedies- Magnesium Can Help

episode of.title: Dr. Mona Vand: The Modern Pharmacist (TV Series 2014– )

5.plot: From a scientific perspective, the best way to reduce the symptoms of a hangover is to prevent them from occurring in the first place.

6.title: What Is a Hangover?

episode of.title: Dr. Mona Vand: The Modern Pharmacist (TV Series 2014– )

6.plot: Two major contributors to a hangover are dehydration, and inflammation. When we focus on preventing these factors, we can prevent many hangover symptoms before they occur.

7.title: Brand Vs Generic Medication - Part 1 - What's the Difference?

episode of.title: Dr. Mona Vand: The Modern Pharmacist (TV Series 2014– )

7.plot: About 80% of prescriptions filled in the United States are for generic drugs, and this number is expected to increase.

8.title: Brand Vs Generic Medication - Part 2 - What Your Prescription Must Say!

episode of.title: Dr. Mona Vand: The Modern Pharmacist (TV Series 2014– )

8.plot: When going to the pharmacy to fill a prescription, patients generally have the choice between choosing the brand or generic version of the drug. In most cases there are no problems with interchanging medications.

9.title: Brand Vs Generic Medication - Part 3 - Compounded

episode of.title: Dr. Mona Vand: The Modern Pharmacist (TV Series 2014– )

9.plot: Compounded medications generally do not possess a brand and generic version. This is because in most cases they are not commercially available products.

10.title: Brand Vs Generic Medication - Part 4 - Switching from One to the Other

episode of.title: Dr. Mona Vand: The Modern Pharmacist (TV Series 2014– )

10.plot: While brand and generic drugs will give you an equal desired outcome, there are some instances in which you should not switch between the two.

11.title: Talking to Your Pharmacist. Part 1

episode of.title: Dr. Mona Vand: The Modern Pharmacist (TV Series 2014– )

11.plot: Pharmacists are one of the most accessible health care professionals in the world, yet not enough people take advantage of the services, knowledge, and free advice offered by these individuals.

12.title: Talking to Your Pharmacist. Part 2

episode of.title: Dr. Mona Vand: The Modern Pharmacist (TV Series 2014– )

12.plot: When it comes to your health, you are your own patient advocate. The Modern Pharmacist movement encourages individuals to take charge and take steps towards achieving overall wellness.

13.title: Erectile Dysfunction - Part 1 - Is It Me?

episode of.title: Dr. Mona Vand: The Modern Pharmacist (TV Series 2014– )

13.plot: Most men hate discussing erectile dysfunction (ED), but it's nothing to be uncomfortable about. It's actually more common than most people think, and it is not only associated with older age.

14.title: Erectile Dysfunction - Part 2 - Which Pill Is Best for You?

episode of.title: Dr. Mona Vand: The Modern Pharmacist (TV Series 2014– )

14.plot: Commonly prescribed drugs for erectile dysfunction (ED) include: Viagra, Cialis and Levitra. A lot of men want to know what the difference is and which is a better choice for them.

15.title: Erectile Dysfunction - Part 3 - Side Effects and Why Pilots Cannot Take Viagra!

episode of.title: Dr. Mona Vand: The Modern Pharmacist (TV Series 2014– )

15.plot: Viagra, Cialis and Levitra are in the same class of medications. They work similarly to treat Erectile Dysfunction. However, each of these brands still maintains their own side effects uniquely different from one to another.

16.title: Erectile Dysfunction - Part 4 - Drug Interactions

episode of.title: Dr. Mona Vand: The Modern Pharmacist (TV Series 2014– )

16.plot: Erectile dysfunction (ED) is a condition in which men are unable to achieve an erection. When used correctly, ED medications are safe and very effective. The major concern lies in potential drug interactions.

17.title: Expired Products- How to Store Your Medication

episode of.title: Dr. Mona Vand: The Modern Pharmacist (TV Series 2014– )

17.plot: All medication has an expiration date, but sometimes it can lose its potency even before it's expired. This often happens when medicine is stored improperly.

18.title: Expired Products - Part 1- Does It Still Work?

episode of.title: Dr. Mona Vand: The Modern Pharmacist (TV Series 2014– )

18.plot: One of the most common questions patients will ask is: "My medicine is expired, does that mean it is not good anymore?"

19.title: Expired Products- Part 2- Will It Harm Me?

episode of.title: Dr. Mona Vand: The Modern Pharmacist (TV Series 2014– )

19.plot: When it comes to expired medication and whether or not it is safe to use, there is a general rule of thumb you can follow. Assuming that your medication is kept sterile and clean, the following guidelines may be able to help you.

20.title: Oral Contraception "The Pill" - Part 1 - Intro

episode of.title: Dr. Mona Vand: The Modern Pharmacist (TV Series 2014– )

20.plot: Oral Contraception, often referred to as "Birth Control" or "The Pill," is a very common medication among women of all ages. This is because it has many different indications, and it is not always being used as a "birth control."

21.title: Oral Contraception "The Pill" - Part 2 - Missing a Pill

episode of.title: Dr. Mona Vand: The Modern Pharmacist (TV Series 2014– )

21.plot: Oral contraception is a very effective form of birth control and one of the most commonly prescribed drugs in a pharmacy.

22.title: Oral Contraception "The Pill" - Part 3 - Two Types

episode of.title: Dr. Mona Vand: The Modern Pharmacist (TV Series 2014– )

22.plot: The hormones found in birth control ("the pill") come in one of two options: Combination (Estrogen + Progesterone), or Mini-pill (Progesterone only).

23.title: Oral Contraception "The Pill" - Part 4 - Side Effects

episode of.title: Dr. Mona Vand: The Modern Pharmacist (TV Series 2014– )

23.plot: As with any medication, you may experience side effects from an oral contraception ("the pill'). Often times though, these side effects can be avoided.

24.title: Oil Pulling

episode of.title: Dr. Mona Vand: The Modern Pharmacist (TV Series 2014– )

24.plot: It's true what they say: history always repeats itself. An ancient remedy known as Oil Pulling has so many benefits that it's hard to believe such a simple practice can produce such a wide array of results.

25.title: Scar Therapy Using Compounded Creams- Part 1

episode of.title: Dr. Mona Vand: The Modern Pharmacist (TV Series 2014– )

25.plot: Whether it's cutting your hand in the kitchen, a child falling off a bike, or a sports injury, it doesn't take much to acquire a scar. However, when treated correctly, permanent scarring can usually be prevented.

26.title: Scar Therapy Using Compounded Creams- Part 2

episode of.title: Dr. Mona Vand: The Modern Pharmacist (TV Series 2014– )

26.plot: Scars develop differently from one person to the next, and treatment is based on multiple factors.

27.title: Fighting Wrinkles with Vitamin E

episode of.title: Dr. Mona Vand: The Modern Pharmacist (TV Series 2014– )

27.plot: Most people think that oily skin is a negative skin type to have, but the moisture from oil is what keeps the elasticity and actually prevents wrinkles. Dry skin leads to cracks and crevices, aka wrinkles. Embrace your oily skin.

28.title: True Facts About Wrinkles

episode of.title: Dr. Mona Vand: The Modern Pharmacist (TV Series 2014– )

28.plot: Most people think that oily skin is a negative skin type to have, but the moisture from oil is what keeps the elasticity and actually prevents wrinkles. Dry skin leads to cracks and crevices, aka wrinkles. Embrace your oily skin.

29.title: What Are Compounded Creams?

episode of.title: Dr. Mona Vand: The Modern Pharmacist (TV Series 2014– )

29.plot: Many patients experience allergies, intolerance, and other unwanted side effects from taking medicine. Often times, these negative effects are not being caused by the actual "medication," they are caused by the fillers.

30.title: What Is a Compounding Pharmacy?

episode of.title: Dr. Mona Vand: The Modern Pharmacist (TV Series 2014– )

30.plot: Walking through the aisles of a pharmacy or drug store tends to be an overwhelming experience. There are numerous brands that appear on every shelf, and it can often be very difficult to find the right product.

imdb.plot outline: Dr. Mona Vand has spent her entire career helping patients achieve optimal wellness. Attending the prestigious Massachusetts College of Pharmacy and Health Sciences, Dr. Vand graduated as a Doctor of Pharmacy in only six years. Upon graduation, she chose to relocate back to the west coast, where she's excelled as a Clinical compounding Pharmacist, tailoring medical treatment to the specific needs of her patients on an individual level. In an era where prescription drugs continue to play an ever-increasing role in the treatment of millions, Dr. Vand's goal is to keep patients informed about the overall benefits -and the potential risk factors - of pharmaceutical products. By expanding the conversation of patient health and traditional medicine, Dr. Vand is helping individuals learn the importance of patient care, food consumption, and making healthier lifestyle choices. While traditional science may consider medication as the first line of defense in the clinical treatment of patients, the modern world requires a pharmacist who can help patients understand that medication is truly only the beginning. Dr. Vand's mission is to teach her patients that medication; diet, exercise and lifestyle are all equally important factors in the daily fight to live well. Dr. Mona Vand is your resource guide to a contemporary pharmaceutical world, creating a movement called, 'The Modern Pharmacist.' Her goal is to help educate and empower a new generation of health conscious patients, while still catering to existing generations who often have questions about the medication they take. By creating one forum for pharmaceutical advice, 'The Modern Pharmacist' movement will help patients understand the connection between pharmaceutical science and overall wellness.

We live in an information age - where now more than ever - people are taking control of their health. And from a health-care perspective, it's amazing that so many patients are becoming their own advocate. But even with all of the information currently on the Internet, people still have questions. People need help connecting pharmaceutical science to overall wellness. What you put in your body - whether it's food, alcohol or even antibiotics - can often times have serious consequences. That's what the Modern Pharmacist is all about. Your health is no longer about eating one apple a day or the yearly physical you take. Your health is a daily journey at living well.::Luck Media & Marketing, Inc.
